Situation1: Their partner had a mildly stressful day at work and mentions it casually.
Expectation2: Deliver packages on time and to the correct address
Situation2: A customer urgently needs their delivery by the promised time window, such as groceries for dinner
Story: I was just about to head out for my last delivery of the evening when my husband called from the living room, his voice softer than usual. He told me about a rough meeting at work, nothing dramatic, but I could hear the fatigue in his words. I knew he wanted me to sit with him, maybe listen, maybe just be there. But my phone buzzed with a reminder: the next delivery was groceries, and the customer had messaged twice, stressing how important it was to get them before dinner. I could picture their anxious face, waiting for me to show up on time. My husband looked at me expectantly, hoping for comfort, while my work app flashed red, demanding urgency. My heart tugged in two directions—toward the man I love and the job I need to do right. I stood in the hallway, keys in hand, torn between being the supportive wife he deserved and the reliable delivery person my customer depended on.
